intro: Gerardia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved gerardia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and has small, rounded leaves that are densely packed along its stems. It is often found in open woodlands and along coastal areas where it thrives in full sun. Gerardia microphylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
